title.justification: The title "Data visualization" appears at the beginning of the abstract and is the overarching theme of the paper as it discusses methods for visualizing local feature attributions in dimensionality reduction, specifically with t-SNE.

extractions.description: This paper presents a methodology for computing local feature attributions for dimensionality reduction techniques, focusing on the t-SNE algorithm. It introduces gradient computation for t-SNE, demonstrates it on datasets like MNIST and SARS-CoV-2, and provides a Python package for implementation.

type.justification: The paper includes experiments and validation on synthetic datasets, MNIST, and SARS-CoV-2 data to demonstrate the utility of the proposed methods.
type.quote: Demonstrates empirical evidence for the methodology on MNIST and SARS-CoV-2 datasets.

name.justification: The paper is published in "Bioinformatics Advances" and applies computational techniques to analyze biological data, such as SARS-CoV-2 sequences and MNIST for biological contexts.
The paper focuses on methods for visualizing local feature attributions in dimensionality reduction techniques, contributing to data visualization.
The paper addresses the problem of feature attributions in dimensionality reduction techniques, particularly using t-SNE.
name.quote:
dimensionality reduction techniques, such as t-distributed
Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE)

name.justification: The paper focuses on computing feature attributions specifically for the t-SNE algorithm, a popular dimensionality reduction technique.
name.quote: produce such attributions for the t-SNE algorithm.

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not introduce t-SNE itself but uses it as a basis for developing its feature attribution method.
is_contributed.quote: We propose a method that can produce such attributions for the t-SNE algorithm.

is_executed.justification: The paper executes t-SNE as part of its methodology to demonstrate the feature attribution technique.
is_executed.quote: Our algorithm can be added to any implementation of t-SNE, with comparable complexity to the original t-SNE fitting procedure.

is_compared.justification: t-SNE is the primary focus for attribution methods in the paper but it is not compared with other models in terms of performance.
is_compared.quote: We propose a method that can produce such attributions for the t-SNE algorithm.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The original paper by van der Maaten and Hinton is referenced for t-SNE.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For a detailed discussion of the t-SNE paper, we refer the reader to the original paper (van der Maaten and Hinton 2008).

name.justification: The paper develops its gradient computation method to be compatible with the Barnes–Hut t-SNE approximation.
name.quote: Produces an algorithm which returns these gradients and is compatible with the Barnes–Hut t-SNE approximation.

is_contributed.justification: Barnes–Hut t-SNE is not a contribution of this paper but is used within the proposed methodology.
is_contributed.quote:
compatible with the Barnes–Hut t-SNE
approximation.

is_executed.justification: The experiments in the paper are conducted using the Barnes–Hut approximation of t-SNE.
is_executed.quote: We note that all experiments reported in this article were done using gradients of the Barnes–Hut approximation of t-SNE.

is_compared.justification: Barnes–Hut t-SNE is not compared to other t-SNE methods or models in the paper.
is_compared.quote: We note that all experiments reported in this article were done using gradients of the Barnes–Hut approximation of t-SNE.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper by van der Maaten discusses the Barnes-Hut approximation method, which is relevant to this paper’s implementation of t-SNE.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We note that all experiments reported in this article were done using gradients of the Barnes–Hut approximation of t-SNE.

name.justification: The paper briefly mentions an attribution experiment performed on the 20 newsgroups dataset.
name.quote: We also performed an additional attribution experiment on the 20 newsgroups dataset that can be found in Supplementary Appendix F.

is_contributed.justification: The 20 newsgroups dataset is a well-known dataset not contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We also performed an additional attribution experiment on the 20 newsgroups dataset that can be found in Supplementary Appendix F.

is_executed.justification: An attribution experiment was performed on the 20 newsgroups dataset as part of their analysis.
is_executed.quote: We also performed an additional attribution experiment on the 20 newsgroups dataset that can be found in Supplementary Appendix F.

is_compared.justification: The 20 newsgroups dataset is used for experimentation but not for model comparison in this paper.
is_compared.quote: We also performed an additional attribution experiment on the 20 newsgroups dataset that can be found in Supplementary Appendix F.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper doesn’t provide a specific referenced paper title for the 20 newsgroups dataset, as it is commonly known and used in text classification studies.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We also performed an additional attribution experiment on the 20 newsgroups dataset that can be found in Supplementary Appendix F.

name.justification: The MNIST dataset is used in experiments to evaluate the proposed feature attribution methodology.
name.quote: We show that our explanations identify significant features using novel validation methodology; using synthetic datasets and the popular MNIST benchmark dataset.

referenced_paper_title.justification: MNIST is a widely known benchmark dataset, so there is no specific referenced paper title provided.
referenced_paper_title.quote: and the popular MNIST benchmark dataset.

name.justification: The SARS-CoV-2 dataset is used for a case study to demonstrate the practical utility of the proposed algorithm.
name.quote: We then demonstrate the practical utility of our algorithm by showing that it can produce explanations that agree with domain knowledge on a SARS-CoV-2 sequence dataset.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper doesn’t provide a specific referenced paper title for the SARS-CoV-2 dataset as it is not attributed to a particular publication.
referenced_paper_title.quote: showing that it can produce explanations that agree with domain knowledge on a SARS-CoV-2 sequence dataset.

name.justification: The 20 newsgroups dataset is mentioned as part of experiments for additional validation of the methodology.
name.quote: We also performed an additional attribution experiment on the 20 newsgroups dataset that can be found in Supplementary Appendix F.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper doesn’t provide a specific referenced paper title for this dataset, as it is commonly used in machine learning tasks.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We also performed an additional attribution experiment on the 20 newsgroups dataset that can be found in Supplementary Appendix F.

name.justification: The authors created a Python package named interpretable_tsne for implementing their proposed feature attribution method for t-SNE.
name.quote: Availability and implementation: We have created a Python package that can be installed using the following command: pip install interpretable_tsne.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The library was introduced in this paper so it doesn’t have a referenced paper to cite.
referenced_paper_title.quote: All code used can be found at github.com/MattScicluna/interpretable_tsne.

name.justification: The paper mentions using the scikit-feature Python package to compute certain scores during validation experiments.
name.quote: To compute the Fisher and Laplace scores, we used the python package scikit-feature.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not reference another specific paper for scikit-feature.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To compute the Fisher and Laplace scores, we used the python package scikit-feature.
